osx-xcode-7.3.description:
`Xcode 7.3.1`, installed on OS X 10.11 (El Capitan).

**LTS** Stack, which means that no preinstalled tool (outside of the
Bitrise CLI components) will be upgraded.

osx-xcode-edge.title: Xcode "Edge" stack
osx-xcode-edge.description:
**This stack is updated every week, upgrading the pre-installed tools to the latest versions**.
If you need stability / no changes in the environment then this stack is not for you. On the other hand,
if you love to always use the latest-and-gratest and you don't mind it if you have to upgrade your
configurations when a new version of a tool breaks your workflow, then this is definitely the macOS stack for you!
*This Edge stack includes the latest **stable** Xcode version.*

linux-docker-android.title: Android & Docker, on Ubuntu 16.04
linux-docker-android.description:
Docker with pre-cached Android setup, installed on Ubuntu 16.04.

You can specify your own Docker image to be used, but
only our images are cached.

**If you'd want to use your own Docker image** please read the guides
at: [http://devcenter.bitrise.io/docs/use-your-own-docker-image](http://devcenter.bitrise.io/docs/use-your-own-docker-image)

linux-docker-android-lts.title: Android & Docker, on Ubuntu 14.04 - LTS Stack
linux-docker-android-lts.description:
**LTS** Stack, which means that no preinstalled tool (outside of the
Bitrise CLI components) will be upgraded.

It uses the `Android NDK LTS Docker Image` ([GitHub](https://github.com/bitrise-docker/android-ndk-lts) / [Docker Hub](https://hub.docker.com/r/bitriseio/android-ndk-lts/)).
